name: Paronychia
description: Paronychia, Caused by an infection of the tissues around the nail with bacteria (often Staphylococcus aureus or Streptococcus). Develops in 2 to 5 days due to a small unnoticed wound.
remedies: Put your finger in the hole of a heated lemon.
Put your finger in car brake oil.
Put your finger in pure bleach.
Crush the skin of the plantain and some peppers, let cool, and apply on the affected area. Replace regularly.

name: Sipon
description: Sipon, Common cold characterized by a runny or stuffy nose, sneezing, and sometimes a sore throat.
remedies: Drink ginger tea with honey.
Inhale steam with eucalyptus oil.
Consume hot chicken soup.

name: Headache
description: Pain in the head or upper neck. Can be caused by various factors including tension, dehydration, or lack of sleep.
remedies: Apply a cold or warm compress to the forehead.
Drink peppermint tea.
Practice deep breathing exercises.

name: Stomach Flu
description: Stomach Flu, Intestinal infection marked by diarrhea, abdominal cramps, nausea, or vomiting. Often caused by viruses.
remedies: Stay hydrated with electrolyte-rich fluids.
Consume ginger tea.
Eat bland foods like rice and bananas.

name: Insomnia
description: Insomnia is a Difficulty falling asleep or staying asleep. Can be caused by stress, anxiety, or other factors.
remedies: Create a bedtime routine.
Drink chamomile tea.
Avoid caffeine and electronics before bedtime.

name: Skin Irritation
description: Redness or inflammation of the skin. Can be caused by allergies, insect bites, or contact with irritants.
remedies: Apply aloe vera gel to the affected area.
Make a lavender-infused oil and apply to the skin.
Use a malunggay-based ointment or cream.

name: Respiratory Allergies
description: Respiratory Allergies, Immune system response to airborne allergens. Symptoms may include sneezing, coughing, and difficulty breathing.
remedies: Inhale steam infused with sampaguita flowers.
Drink lavender tea to soothe respiratory symptoms.
Include malunggay in your diet for its anti-allergic properties.

name: Cough
description: Cough , Reflex action to clear the throat and airways of mucus, typically caused by irritation.
remedies: Drink honey and lemon tea.
Consume thyme tea.
Gargle with salt water.

name: Allergies
description: Immune system response to substances that are usually harmless, resulting in symptoms like sneezing, itching, and congestion.
remedies: Drink nettle tea.
Use butterbur supplements (consult a doctor).
Consume local honey.

name: Migraine
description: Severe headache often accompanied by nausea, vomiting, and sensitivity to light and sound.
remedies: Apply peppermint oil to the temples.
Drink chamomile tea.
Practice relaxation techniques.

name: Joint Pain
description: Pain and discomfort in the joints, often caused by inflammation or arthritis.
remedies: Apply aloe vera gel to the affected joints.
Turmeric supplements or tea.
Gentle exercise and stretching.

name: Hives
description: Raised, itchy welts on the skin, usually caused by an allergic reaction.
remedies: Apply calamine lotion.
Take an oatmeal bath.
Use cold compresses on affected areas.

name: Indigestion
description: Discomfort or pain in the upper abdomen, often associated with overeating or consuming certain foods.
remedies: Chew on basil leaves.
Drink ginger tea.
Consume fennel seeds after meals.

name: Anxiety
description: Excessive worry, fear, or uneasiness, often accompanied by physical symptoms.
remedies: Drink lavender tea.
Practice deep breathing exercises.
Consider passionflower supplements (consult a doctor).

name: Burns
description: Damage to the skin caused by heat, chemicals, electricity, or sunlight.
remedies: Apply aloe vera gel to the burn.
Use lavender oil for soothing effects.
Run cool water over the affected area.

name: Plema
description: Excessive mucus or phlegm in the respiratory system, often associated with respiratory infections or allergies.
remedies: Inhale steam infused with lagundi leaves.
Drink coconut water to help hydrate and loosen mucus.
Consume aloe vera juice for its soothing properties.

name: Dandruff
description: Flaky and itchy scalp condition, often caused by dry skin or an overgrowth of yeast.
remedies: Apply aloe vera gel to the scalp to moisturize and soothe irritation.
Rinse hair with a solution of basil-infused water to combat dandruff.
Massage coconut oil into the scalp for hydration and anti-fungal properties.

name: Eczema
description: Skin condition characterized by red, itchy, and inflamed patches.
remedies: Apply coconut oil to the affected areas to moisturize and reduce inflammation.
Use calendula-infused cream for its soothing and anti-inflammatory effects.
Take a bath with oatmeal to relieve itching associated with eczema.

name: Earache
description: Eczema, Pain or discomfort in the ear, often caused by infection or inflammation.
remedies: Warm coconut oil and gently apply a few drops to the affected ear for relief.
Infuse olive oil with garlic and use it as ear drops for its antimicrobial properties.
Drink chamomile tea to help reduce inflammation and soothe earache.

name: Nausea
description: Feeling of queasiness or discomfort in the stomach, often preceding vomiting.
remedies: Chew on ginger root or drink ginger tea to alleviate nausea.
Sip on peppermint tea for its calming effect on the digestive system.
Consume basil leaves or tea to relieve nausea and improve digestion.
